text: The transcription factor AP-1 is an important human mediator of the cellular response to serum , growth factors , and phorbol esters such as 12-O-tetradecanoyl-phorbol-13 acetate ( TPA ) .

The AP-1 complex consists of distinct protein heterodimers encoded by the proto-oncogene <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA whose gene expression can be induced by TPA , cyclic AMP and growth factors .

text: To investigate the role of reactive oxygen species we studied the effects of alpha-lipoic acid and dihydrolipoic acid ( natural thiol antioxidants ) on the expression of <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in human Jurkat T cells .

text: When cells were preincubated with dihydrolipoic acid ( 0.2 mM ) the expression of <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was suppressed at 30 min after stimulation of TPA ( 0.5 microM ) whereas in the case of preincubation of alpha-lipoic acid ( 0.2 microM ) , the expression was enhanced at 30 min .
